intro: Erodium mouretii, commonly known as the Mouret's bird's-beak, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces distinctive pink or purple flowers that bloom in the spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Erodium mouretii is typically found in rocky or gravelly soils, thriving in sunny, well-drained environments. It is often used in rock gardens and as a decorative plant due to its elegant appearance and hardy nature.
